meanings.definition: A carbanion is an anion in which a carbon atom has a formal negative charge.
meanings.sent1: The carbanion is a negatively charged carbon atom.
meanings.sent2: Organic chemists study the properties of carbanions.
meanings.sent3: The carbanion decided to join the negative charge party.
meanings.sent4: In the world of molecules, the carbanion stands out as the rebel with a negative cause.
meanings.sent5: Picture the carbanion as a tiny, charged carbon superhero.

meanings.definition: Carbanions are commonly formed in organic chemistry reactions by the donation of a lone pair of electrons to the carbon atom.
meanings.sent1: During the reaction, the carbanion gains an extra electron.
meanings.sent2: Chemists use carbanions to create new compounds.
meanings.sent3: The carbanion happily accepted the donated electron, feeling complete.
meanings.sent4: In the dance of electrons, the carbanion is the graceful recipient of a lone pair.
meanings.sent5: Imagine the carbanion as a carbon atom with a special electron gift.
